page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Walshaw Church}was built in 1893.The vicar is the Reverend Hope.The church was built by the local mill owners from a local stone.The church is unusual because it has a clock in the spire.In the church there is a piece of carpet which was used for the coronation in 1953.This piece of carpet was given to the church in 1974 and is unique. {Walshaw Cross}is a war memorial which commemorates the people of Walshaw who died in the first and second world war.It is 65 years old.It is about seventeen feet high and seven feet wide.There are sixty-one names on it.One side is dedicated to people who died in the first world war and the other for those in the second.It was erected by the public subscription and was unveiled on August 20th. 1920.
